intro: Pelargonium platyphyllum, commonly known as the flatleaf geranium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Geraniaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its broad, flat leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers. Pelargonium platyphyllum is also valued for its ability to thrive in coastal climates and its use in traditional medicine.
